etymology.description: Phonetic: 七(七) (qī, 'seven') + Semantic: 刀(刀) (dāo, 'knife') = sharp object -> to cut
etymology.interpretation: The character 切(qiè, 'to cut') combines the sound component 七(qī, 'seven') with the semantic component 刀(dāo, 'knife'). This implies the action of cutting with a sharp tool.

examples.chinese: 厨房的刀非常锋利(廚房的刀非常鋒利)，切菜时请小心(切菜時請小心)。
examples.pinyin: chúfáng de dāo fēicháng fēnglì, qiè cài shí qǐng xiǎoxīn.
examples.english: The kitchen knife is very sharp, so be careful when cutting vegetables.

examples.chinese: 一切问题都能解决(一切問題都能解決)。
